headline: Capri Global attracts investment from Prashant Jain in Rs 2,000 cr QIP
content: Prashant Jain's 3P Investment Managers invested ₹150 crore in Capri Global Capital through its Category-III Alternative Investment Fund, as part of Capri Global's successful ₹2,000-crore QIP. The QIP saw strong demand from institutional investors, including Quant Mutual Fund, BlackRock and several insurance companies. Capri Global intends to use the funds to bolster capital adequacy and support future expansion plans.

headline: FIFA Club World Cup 2025 faces challenges in US debut amid ticket woes and player backlash
content: FIFA’s revamped 32-team Club World Cup debuts in the US this week, bringing top international clubs and players to American stadiums. However, concerns over player workloads, sluggish ticket sales, and pricing controversies have raised questions about the tournament’s reception and viability. FIFA aims to expand global club competition through this format

headline: FIFA Club World Cup 2025: How to watch matches through cable TV or stream online? Here’s start date, end date, venues, teams, opening match date, time, where to watch and how to buy match tickets
content: The FIFA Club World Cup 2025 begins June 14 in the United States. The tournament features 32 football clubs including Inter Miami CF, PSG, and Bayern Munich. Matches will take place in 12 stadiums across 11 US cities. Fans can watch via cable or online streaming platforms like DAZN and Hulu.

headline: Wall Street Week Ahead: Fed meeting in focus as investors seek rate-path hints
content: Investors are closely watching the Federal Reserve's upcoming policy meeting for signals on potential rate cuts amid concerns about a softening labor market and persistent inflation. Recent geopolitical tensions and trade uncertainties add to market volatility, while upcoming retail sales data and the looming end of a tariff pause further fuel investor caution.

headline: Will Los Angeles protests disrupt World Cup and Olympics? Is FIFA relocating matches to Mexico and Canada?
content: Los Angeles, a key city for the 2026 FIFA World Cup and 2028 Olympics, faces scrutiny amid nationwide immigration protests against President Trump's policies. Concerns are rising about how these tensions might impact preparations for the sporting events. Despite official assurances and exemptions for athletes, visa delays and travel bans have sparked worries about discouraging international participation.

headline: Can the US successfully deliver FIFA Club World Cup 2025?
content: With the FIFA Club World Cup 2025 imminent in the US, concerns about pitch readiness, especially in NFL venues, are addressed by FIFA's assurances of natural grass and regulation sizes. This tournament, featuring 32 elite clubs and a $1 billion prize, serves as a crucial prelude to the 2026 World Cup, testing infrastructure and attracting global attention.

headline: FIFA Club World Cup 2025: Complete schedule, dates, timings, groups - All you need to know
content: The FIFA Club World Cup 2025, featuring 32 teams, will be held in the United States from June 14 to July 13 across 12 stadiums. Lionel Messi's Inter Miami will face Al-Ahly in the opening match in Miami, while the final is scheduled for MetLife Stadium in New Jersey. The tournament includes group stages and direct elimination rounds.

headline: Aaron Rodgers expected to sign with Steelers ahead of mandatory minicamp
content: Aaron Rodgers is expected to sign with the Pittsburgh Steelers and report for mandatory minicamp next week, according to ESPN. The veteran quarterback, a free agent since leaving the New York Jets, would fill a key need for the Steelers and potentially face his former team in Week 1

headline: Lionel Messi in spotlight as FIFA's Club World Cup 2025 set to kick off in US
content: The FIFA Club World Cup 2025 will start in June. Thirty-two top clubs will compete in the US. The final match is on July 13 in New Jersey. Inter Miami will play Al Ahly in the first match. FIFA has announced a prize money of $1 billion. The winner will get $125 million. The tournament will have eight groups.

headline: FIFA Club World Cup 2025: Full schedule, groups, and key fixtures unveiled for U.S. debut
content: The FIFA Club World Cup 2025 heads to the U.S. for its largest edition yet, featuring 32 clubs from 20 nations. With Messi, elite teams, and expanded groups, the month-long tournament kicks off May 31 and culminates July 13 at MetLife Stadium, NJ.

headline: Billionaire Selena Gomez rubs fans the wrong way by posting Instagram photo - users call it rich person behaviour
content: Selena Gomez is in the news. She attended Beyonce's concert at MetLife Stadium. Gomez watched a New York Knicks game on her phone during the event. She posted about it on Instagram. This sparked debate online. Some users criticized her actions.

headline: Is Shakira physically fit? After abdominal pain, the singer now falls onstage at Montreal concert
content: Shakira's "Las Mujeres Ya No Lloran" tour has experienced both triumphs and challenges. Despite a fall onstage in Montreal during "Whenever, Whenever," she recovered swiftly and continued her performance. Earlier, she had to postpone a show in Peru due to an abdominal issue.

headline: Shakira's concert sparks measles outbreak scare: Check a list of most-affected US states, symptoms and vaccine
content: A measles outbreak, the worst in over two decades, is sweeping the US, with Texas as the epicenter. Over 1,000 cases have been confirmed across 31 states, resulting in three deaths. Health officials are concerned about declining vaccination rates and the potential loss of the nation's measles elimination status, urging people to get vaccinated.

headline: Indian football fans can skip long US visa wait times for FIFA 2026 by travelling to Canada or Mexico
content: Indian football fans planning to attend the FIFA World Cup 2026 can consider Canada and Mexico. These countries offer faster visa processing compared to the United States. Matches will be held in Toronto, Vancouver, Mexico City, Guadalajara, and Monterrey. Fans can avoid long US visa delays by applying through Canada or Mexico.

headline: Planning to attend FIFA World Cup 2026 in the US? Now is the time to apply for your visa
content: Indian football fans, get ready for the FIFA World Cup 2026 in the United States. Visa application is a must now. US consulates across India are facing long wait times. The tournament will be hosted by the United States, Mexico, and Canada. The US will host most of the matches. Apply early to avoid any last-minute issues.

headline: Did Shakira's concert in New Jersey last week contribute to the spread of the world's most infectious disease? Here's what reports say
content: After a Shakira concert in New Jersey, health officials warned fans about possible measles exposure. One infected person attended, raising concerns over the spread of this fast-moving disease among thousands at the venue.

headline: FIFA Club World Cup 2025 US ticket sales begins: Check venues, dates, teams, live streaming details
content: The FIFA Club World Cup 2025 will be arriving in the US in an all new format. The fixtures will begin on June 15 and culminate with a finale in July. With stars like Messi and Mbappé expected to play in the tournament, fans can get their hands on tickets using the details below.

headline: New Jersey Transit strike could impact 350,000 commuters; no 'train or bus service' for Shakira's concerts
content: Union representing engineers of New Jersey Transit’s commuter trains will walk out on early Friday if the contract deal is not reached anytime soon. The strike, first in more than four decades, will affect thousands of commuters in the US state. It could also impact those willing to attend Shakira’s concert, as she is scheduled to perform in the city later this week.

headline: George Heber Joseph joins Blackstone–backed ASK Investment Managers as CIO and CEO (Equity)
content: ASK Investment Managers has appointed George Heber Joseph as CIO and CEO (Equity) to lead its equity platform, including PMS, AIFs, and upcoming mutual funds. With decades of market experience, George will drive innovation, expand product offerings, and strengthen ASK’s position across investor segments with a fundamentals-driven, data-backed investment approach.

headline: MetLife first-quarter profit rises on strong investment gains; launches $3 billion buyback
content: MetLife reported a nearly 5% rise in first-quarter profit, fueled by higher premiums and investment income, further announcing a $3 billion share buyback. Increased risk from cyber attacks and global events has sustained insurance spending, leading to higher premium prices. The insurer will also reinsure $10 billion in U.S. retail variable annuity reserves.

headline: Insurance mafia turned death into business; 800-page chargesheet filed in scam worth hundreds of crores
content: An insurance scam, amounting to hundreds of crores, has been exposed in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal district, leading to an 800-page chargesheet against 11 accused from multiple states. The 'insurance mafia' allegedly created fraudulent life insurance policies for terminally ill or deceased individuals, siphoning funds from leading insurance companies.

headline: PNB MetLife announces Rs 594 crore bonus to policyholders for FY22
content: The insurer said it has been consistently declaring bonuses on participating products every year, and the bonus amount for FY22 is 12 per cent higher than that of FY21. This bonus sum will benefit 4.95 lakh customers whose policies were in force as of 31st March 2022, PNB MetLife said in a release.

headline: MetLife to hike stake in India JV to over 42%
content: New York-based insurer MetLife is set to increase its stake in its Indian life insurance joint venture PNB MetLife by acquiring 15.27% held by the Dabriwala family, for Rs 1,906 crore, the firm announced on Monday. The move, which values PNB MetLife at around Rs 12,480 crore, will be subject to regulatory approvals from both the Competition Commission of India and the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (Irdai).

headline: Metlife plans to raise its stake in Indian venture; acquire stake of IGE, Elpro
content: MetLife said it had entered into an agreement with IGE India and Elpro International to acquire their combined stake of 15.27% in PNB MetLife India Insurance Company Limited. The deal will boost MetLife's stake in PNB MetLife to more than 47%.

headline: PNB MetLife to sell policies to Baharain Bank customers
content: As a part of this tie-up, PNB MetLife will offer its wide array of best-in-class and innovative insurance solutions to BBK's India customers spread across its branches, said PNB MetLife.

headline: PNB MetLife appoints Ashish Kumar Srivastava as MD and CEO
content: Ashish joined PNB MetLife in 2013 as the Head of Human Resources before subsequently moving to Dubai in 2015 to take charge of Human Resources for the MetLife Middle East and Africa (MEA) region.

headline: PNB gets regulatory approvals for acquiring 30% stake in Metlife India Insurance, company to be re-branded
content: Punjab National Bank today said it has received all regulatory approvals for acquiring 30 per cent stake in Metlife India Insurance.

headline: CCI approves stake buy by PNB in MetLife India Insurance
content: Fair trade regulator CCI has approved 30 per cent stake purchase by state-owned Punjab National Bank (PNB) in MetLife India Insurance Company.

headline: MetLife launches new term insurance product online
content: Private sector insurer MetLife India Insurance today launched a term insurance product Met Protect, the first such life cover plan by the company to be available online.
